articles.headline: As War Enters Classrooms, Fear Grips Afghans
articles.snippet: The Taliban and other militant groups in Afghanistan are taking aim at hundreds of public schools.
articles.abstract: The Taliban and other militant groups in Afghanistan are taking aim at hundreds of public schools.
articles.lead_paragraph: QALAI SAYEDAN, Afghanistan, July 9 — With their teacher absent, 10 students were allowed to leave school early. These were the girls the gunmen saw first, 10 easy targets walking hand-in-hand through the blue metal gate and on to the winding dirt road.

articles.headline: Chief of Capital One Applies Hockey Strategies to Banking
articles.snippet: Richard D. Fairbank, the chairman of Capital One Financial, keeps his eye on the “Gretzky Concept” as he moves into retail banking.
articles.abstract: Richard D. Fairbank, the chairman of Capital One Financial, keeps his eye on the “Gretzky Concept” as he moves into retail banking.
articles.lead_paragraph: Richard D. Fairbank plays center on a full-contact recreational hockey team. He coaches his youth teams at the local rink, and is a part owner of the Washington Capitals.

articles.headline: U.S. Envoy Offers Grim Prediction on Iraq Pullout
articles.snippet: Ryan C. Crocker and the Iraqi foreign minister warned that withdrawing U.S. troops could lead to a wider war.
articles.abstract: Ryan C. Crocker and the Iraqi foreign minister warned that withdrawing U.S. troops could lead to a wider war.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, July 9 — As the Senate prepares to begin a new debate this week on proposals for a withdrawal from Iraq, the United States ambassador and the Iraqi foreign minister are warning that the departure of American troops could lead to sharply increased violence, the deaths of thousands and a regional conflict that could draw in Iraq’s neighbors.
articles.byline: By John F. Burns and Alissa J. Rubin

articles.headline: Google Buys a Manager of E-Mail
articles.snippet: Taking further aim at one of Microsoft’s core franchises, Google said that it would acquire Postini for $625 million in cash.
articles.abstract: Taking further aim at one of Microsoft’s core franchises, Google said that it would acquire Postini for $625 million in cash.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, July 9 — Taking further aim at one of Microsoft’s core franchises, Google said Monday that it would acquire the e-mail security and management company Postini for $625 million in cash.

articles.headline: With Pressure Put on Hamas, Gaza Is Cut Off
articles.snippet: In the month since Hamas took over Gaza, the 1.5 million Palestinians there have become more isolated than ever.
articles.abstract: In the month since Hamas took over Gaza, the 1.5 million Palestinians there have become more isolated than ever.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM, July 9  In the month since Hamas took over Gaza, the 1.5 million Palestinians there have become more cut off than ever, supplies and jobs slipping away as its rival, Fatah, backed by Israel and the West, presses Hamas.
articles.byline: By Steven Erlanger and Isabel Kershner

articles.headline: A Maverick of Industry in Canada
articles.snippet: As the chairman of the auto parts maker Magna International, Frank Stronach’s management style has both enriched and alienated shareholders.
articles.abstract: As the chairman of the auto parts maker Magna International, Frank Stronach’s management style has both enriched and alienated shareholders.
articles.lead_paragraph: TORONTO — Frank Stronach, the chairman of the auto parts maker Magna International, stood before shareholders at the company’s annual meeting in May and, instead of discussing an offer he had put on the table for Chrysler, entered a debate in jest about who was more alluring to women, himself or his longtime aide, Manfred Gingl.

articles.headline: Ex-Partner at Milberg Pleads Guilty to Conspiracy
articles.snippet: The guilty plea is the latest blow to a powerhouse firm that once dominated the landscape for class-action securities lawsuits.
articles.abstract: The guilty plea is the latest blow to a powerhouse firm that once dominated the landscape for class-action securities lawsuits.
articles.lead_paragraph: A seven-year federal investigation into accusations that a leading securities class-action law firm, Milberg Weiss, paid secret kickbacks to plaintiffs gained traction yesterday when David J. Bershad, a former partner with extensive knowledge of the firm’s finances, pleaded guilty to conspiracy and agreed to cooperate with prosecutors.

articles.headline: Costs Surge for Building Power Plants
articles.snippet: As talk of building new power plants rises sharply, a new fleet of coal-fired power plants and a revival of nuclear construction are both looking tougher due to rising costs.
articles.abstract: As talk of building new power plants rises sharply, a new fleet of coal-fired power plants and a revival of nuclear construction are both looking tougher due to rising costs.
articles.lead_paragraph: General Electric called in reporters yesterday for a briefing on a nuclear plant it is trying to sell in partnership with Hitachi, a plant it said can be built faster than before, operated reliably and have a vanishingly small chance of an accident.
